page.title: 09ST. JOHN'S CHURCH SOUTHALL
page.content: St. John's Church is Anglican. Apart from the church there is a parish centre and a play centre. In 1910 a new church was built to replace the old which had become too small. It faces East and is built of limestone from the south of England. The ceilings are of wood. The stone font was brought from the original church in King Street. It took one year to build. So far twelve vicars have worked there. There is one bell so the present vicar uses a tape recording of bells to call the people to the services. ______________________________________ {Acknowledgements} The schools who took part in this survey were; Dormers Wells High, Durdans Park Middle, Hobbayne Combined, Lady Margaret Middle, North Combined and St. Marks Combined.We would have liked more time
